result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam James Blouin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam James Blouin in court.  Attorney Tyler David Rasmussen in court for Adam James Blouin.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam James Blouin in court.  Attorney Tyler David Rasmussen in court for Adam James Blouin.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam James Blouin in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RKS.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Adam James Blouin in court with Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/26/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-26-2022 @1p
